snippet: The president signed an executive order urging companies to exchange data on cyberthreats and receive classified information from the government.
abstract: Pres Obama signs executive order urging private sector companies to cooperate with federal government in sharing data on cyberthreats, in industry Obama refers to as 'Wild Wild West'; order does not exempt companies from liability if shared data leads to legal action, something only legislation can do; Obama speaks to cybersecurity leaders at summit meeting at Stanford University.

byline.original: By NICOLE PERLROTH and DAVID E. SANGER

lead_paragraph: The president signed an executive order urging companies to exchange data on cyberthreats and receive classified information from the government.

headline.main: Obama Calls for New Cooperation to Wrangle the ‘Wild West’ Internet
headline.print_headline: Obama Calls for New Cooperation to Wrangle the ‘Wild West’ Internet
